sense.name: to combat or oppose someone or something
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 FIGHT NP2 Includes: FIGHT BACK, FIGHT DOWN, FIGHT OFF, FIGHT AGAINST
sense.examples: The armies fought on the outskirts of Moscow. My cats are always fighting. Don't fight it, just go with the flow. If they start cutting down our forest, we'll fight back. He fought down the urge to do the man harm. The family fought off the burglers.

sense.name: to strive, make a strenuous effort
sense.commentary: Note: This sense implies attempting or trying to do something.
sense.examples: She is fighting for her life. We fought our way through brambles and bushes to reach the stream.

sense.name: promote, campaign or crusade for someone or something
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 FIGHT PP{for NP}
sense.examples: They are fighting for Social Security reforms. She has always fought for children's rights.
